discussion.content:
Hi, 
ABC is correct:

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-55FC02D4-F5B3-4357-BB6B-78240B7F16BA.html
Is this correct? - i thought ABC
A,B,C is correct.
A B C correct. Passed with 500/500 today

Correct Answers are A,B,C. Others are wrong. 
The above are also listed on this link: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-55FC02D4-F5B3-4357-BB6B-78240B7F16BA.html
If you need further clarification see below:
A. ISO image from the datastore - (we know that it works)
B. CD-ROM (we know that it works)
C. ISO image from a Content Library (Introduced in vsphere 6.0 - basically a repository/container for your templates, iso files and scripts - I have a subscribed version to which all my 7 vCenter servers subscribe so that I can keep only one copy of my VM Templates across the enterprise, instead of separate templates in each vcenter server
D. ISO image from an external FTP Server - incorrect
E. ISO image from Update Manager repository - incorrect

CD , ISO, ISO from Content Library
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-55FC02D4-F5B3-4357-BB6B-78240B7F16BA.html ( install a guest OS from Media URL)
ABC is correct during exam. Passed 07 dec 20 with 500/500

questions.question_text: Which three installation methods are supported for a guest operating system within a virtual machine? (Choose three.)

choices.C: ISO image from a Content Library
choices.E: ISO image from Update Manager repository
choices.D: ISO image from an external FTP Server

choices.A: Satisfy prerequisites and enable Beacon probing.
choices.B: Enable Explicit failover order and ensure Failback is selected.
choices.C: Enable Explicit failover order and ensure Notify Switches is selected.

discussion.content: correct answer. beacon probing is the network failure detection option

A vSphere administrator has been tasked with enabling upstream failure detection for networking in an environment that does not support link state tracking.

questions.question_text: Which three features can be configured during the initial creation of a cluster (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
ABC because the term Proactive HA is enabled from another configuration

see the link that shows D is not correct
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.avail.doc/GUID-3E3B18CC-8574-46FA-9170-CF549B8E55B8.html

ABC is correct during exam. Passed 07 dec 20 with 500/500
however the right options in vSphere are
-vSphere HA
-vSphere DRS
-vSAN

but not in exam.

ABC is correct. 
Yes there's Proactive HA but it is not available during Cluster creation - only vsphere HA is available. 
The question is based on vsphere 6.5 platform: Available options are:
 - DRS
 - vsphere HA
 - EVC
 - virtual SAN
For vsphere 6.7 you have:
 - vsphere DRs
 - vsphere HA
 - vSAN
*Meant that in vsphere 6.7 you have to configure EVC after setting up the cluster. 
Proactive HA is not an option during initial cluster setup - so it is incorrect
Is there such thing as Proactive HA?

The question's answer is not correct.
### The correct answer should be vSphere HA, vSphere DRS, vSAN.
ACD is the right answer.

In the reference about creating a cluster, check the prerequisites.
"If you want to use vSAN, it must be enabled before you configure vSphere HA."

Not all clusters are configured as a vSAN. Plus a vSAN must be configured before creating a cluster. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-487C09CE-8BE2-4B89-BA30-0E4F7E3C66F7.html

This question is bogus, just checked the options. EVC and Proactive HA are not there. 

You have vSAN, DRS and HA. Not proactive HA

comments.content: Sorry - I replied to the wrong comment

Check your reference compared to the answers. Initially, you can configure DRS, EVC and vSphere HA (but not yet Proactive HA). Proactive HA can only be configured after DRS has been configured.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.avail.doc/GUID-3E3B18CC-8574-46FA-9170-CF549B8E55B8.html

discussion.content:
Answer is correct!

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-487C09CE-8BE2-4B89-BA30-0E4F7E3C66F7.html
Proactive HA should be enabled after you add hosts into the cluster, but the question is asking the initiating phase, hence the D is not correct.

This document describes "Cluster Creation", as such, all four options are viable.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.avail.doc/GUID-3E3B18CC-8574-46FA-9170-CF549B8E55B8.html
